info.title: Test API Documentation
info.description: This is a sample example of API documentation.

groups.name: Sum
groups.description: An API for working with maths. Provides add, divide, mulitple and subtract endpoints which calulate your sums.

code.name: JavaScript
Node.js
Shell
code.snippet:
curl --request PUT \
  --url http://localhost:3007/v1/sum/add/5/5

endpoints.description: Adds together two numbers and return the result. As an option you can have the result return as a binary number.

code.name: JavaScript
Node.js
Shell
code.snippet:
curl --request PUT \
  --url http://localhost:3007/v1/sum/divide/5/5

endpoints.description: Divides the first number by the second and return the result

path.name: a
path.description: the first number - can NOT be 0

path.name: b
path.description: the second number - can NOT be 0

X-Rate-Limit-Limit.description: The number of allowed requests in the current period

X-Rate-Limit-Remaining.description: The number of remaining requests in the current period

X-Rate-Limit-Reset.description: The number of seconds left in the current period

code.name: JavaScript
Node.js
Shell
code.snippet:
curl --request PUT \
  --url http://localhost:3007/v1/sum/multiple/5/5

endpoints.description: Multiples the two numbers together and return the result

X-Rate-Limit-Limit.description: The number of allowed requests in the current period

X-Rate-Limit-Remaining.description: The number of remaining requests in the current period

X-Rate-Limit-Reset.description: The number of seconds left in the current period

code.name: JavaScript
Node.js
Shell
code.snippet:
curl --request PUT \
  --url http://localhost:3007/v1/sum/subtract/5/5

endpoints.description: Subtracts the second number from the first and return the result

X-Rate-Limit-Limit.description: The number of allowed requests in the current period

X-Rate-Limit-Remaining.description: The number of remaining requests in the current period

X-Rate-Limit-Reset.description: The number of seconds left in the current period

groups.name: Store
groups.description: An API for storing sum data. You can list, add, delete, get and update the sums in the store. It has 3 ways of adding a new sum.

code.name: JavaScript
Node.js
Shell
code.snippet:
curl --request GET \
  --url 'http://localhost:3007/v1/store/?page=1&pagesize=10' \
  --header 'x-format: decimal'

endpoints.description: List the sums in the data store

header.description: return result as decimal or binary
header.name: x-format

query.description: the number of items to a page
query.name: pagesize

X-Rate-Limit-Limit.description: The number of allowed requests in the current period

X-Rate-Limit-Remaining.description: The number of remaining requests in the current period

X-Rate-Limit-Reset.description: The number of seconds left in the current period

code.name: JavaScript
Node.js
Shell
code.snippet:
curl --request POST \
  --url http://localhost:3007/v1/store/ \
  --data 'a=10&b=0&operator=%2B&equals=0'

endpoints.description: Adds a sum to the data store

X-Rate-Limit-Limit.description: The number of allowed requests in the current period

X-Rate-Limit-Remaining.description: The number of remaining requests in the current period

X-Rate-Limit-Reset.description: The number of seconds left in the current period

code.name: JavaScript
Node.js
Shell
code.snippet:
curl --request POST \
  --url http://localhost:3007/v1/store/file/ \
  --data file=filename.txt

endpoints.description: Adds a sum to the data store, using JSON object in a uploaded file

form.name: file
form.description: json file with object containing: a, b, operator and equals

X-Rate-Limit-Limit.description: The number of allowed requests in the current period

X-Rate-Limit-Remaining.description: The number of remaining requests in the current period

X-Rate-Limit-Reset.description: The number of seconds left in the current period

code.name: JavaScript
Node.js
Shell
code.snippet:
curl --request POST \
  --url http://localhost:3007/v1/store/payload/ \
  --data '{"a":0,"b":0,"operator":"+","equals":0}'

endpoints.description: Adds a sum to the data store, using JSON object in payload

X-Rate-Limit-Limit.description: The number of allowed requests in the current period

X-Rate-Limit-Remaining.description: The number of remaining requests in the current period

X-Rate-Limit-Reset.description: The number of seconds left in the current period

code.name: JavaScript
Node.js
Shell
code.snippet:
curl --request DELETE \
  --url http://localhost:3007/v1/store/string

endpoints.description: Delete a sums from the data store

path.name: id
path.description: the id of the sum in the store

X-Rate-Limit-Limit.description: The number of allowed requests in the current period

X-Rate-Limit-Remaining.description: The number of remaining requests in the current period

X-Rate-Limit-Reset.description: The number of seconds left in the current period

code.name: JavaScript
Node.js
Shell
code.snippet:
curl --request GET \
  --url http://localhost:3007/v1/store/string

endpoints.description: Get a sum from the store

path.name: id
path.description: the id of the sum in the store

X-Rate-Limit-Limit.description: The number of allowed requests in the current period

X-Rate-Limit-Remaining.description: The number of remaining requests in the current period

X-Rate-Limit-Reset.description: The number of seconds left in the current period

code.name: JavaScript
Node.js
Shell
code.snippet:
curl --request PUT \
  --url http://localhost:3007/v1/store/string \
  --data 'a=0&b=0&operator=%2B&equals=0'

endpoints.description: Update a sum in our data store

path.name: id
path.description: the id of the sum in the store

X-Rate-Limit-Limit.description: The number of allowed requests in the current period

X-Rate-Limit-Remaining.description: The number of remaining requests in the current period

X-Rate-Limit-Reset.description: The number of seconds left in the current period

before.html:
This document describes v2 of the Auth0 API, which is meant to be used by back-end servers or trusted parties performing administrative tasks. Generally speaking, anything that can be done through the Auth0 dashboard (and more) can also be done through this API.

APIv2 is intended as a replacement for APIv1, an earlier version of the API. APIv2 is production ready and is recommended for any new integrations. To learn more about the differences between v1 and v2, please refer to this document.

This API is separate from the publicly accessible authentication API, which is meant to be used by front-ends and untrusted parties.
before.name: Introduction

before.html:
There are two main approaches to obtaining a token to call the API:

Use the Token Generator on the top-left of this page

  • Construct and sign a JWT yourself using http://jwt.io or any of the listed JWT libraries
  • Whatever approach you choose, we recommend storing tokens in your application directly, and not generating them dynamically using your API secret.

Tokens created with the Token Generator in this page do not contain an exp claim, which means they never expire. You can use the Token Generator to create tokens for your production application without writing any code.
before.name: API key

after.html: Usage policy defines the uses you can put the data to.
after.name: Usage policy
